data.title: Curbside Recycling & Garbage
data.text:
Curbside Pickup

Page Content

About

About

Alachua County provides the collection of solid waste, recycling, and yard waste for citizens in designated service areas. It is our mission to provide quality collection services while striving to reach our waste diversion goals. ​

True

Curbside Pickup Guidelines

Curbside Pickup Guidelines

​​​​​Curbside Household Garbage Collection

Carts are for household garbage only.

The following items are NOT accepted in your garbage cart:

​Recycling

Yard Waste

Dead animals

Hot ashes

Solvents, paints, hazardous materials, or flammable liquids​

​Please observe the following guidelines:​

​Place your solid waste and recycling receptacles curbside/roadside by 7am on the collection day, no earlier than 5pm the day before your scheduled pick up

Remove your solid waste and recycling receptacles from curbside/roadside by 9pm on your collection day

Make sure your garbage is bagged before it's placed in the cart. Please, Bag and Tie So the Trash Won't Fly!

Cart lid must close.

​If you have more garbage than your cart will hold, place garbage in an officially marked yellow bag and put it next to your cart. You can purchase these bags at your local Publix Supermarket. Please call 352-338-3233 for more information.

Curbside Recycling Collection

​​Light Rinse: By rinsing out all food containers, you raise the value of the material. Unrinsed items may not be collected as they contaminate the other recyclables.

Off With the Lids: Please remove lids from plastic or glass bottles and jars. They can become projectiles if they are attached to containers that are put into the bailing machine and can pose a threat to recycling workers. Lids can also damage equipment by getting jammed in gears and other workings. One exception: you can recycle metal lids on cans, for example soup cans. Leave these metal lids attached or place them in the bottom of cans and pinch the top of the cans together.

Step on it: You can save space by crushing aluminum cans and plastic containers. Now that you're recycling all that you can, you are going to need the space!

Wait Until It's Full: If your bin contains only a few items, do not set it out yet. Wait until it's full.

No Need to Remove Labels

Click Here​​ to learn what items are recyclable!

Curbside Yard Waste Collection

Yard waste includes leaves, grass clippings and small tree limbs. It does NOT include boards or lumber. All yard waste collected curbside is recycled. Please do not contaminate it with garbage!

Debris generated by tree surgeons or other commercial enterprises will not be collected.

​​Limbs must be less than 5 feet in length.

Smaller than 8 inches in diameter.

Yard waste should be put in paper yard waste bags or reusable, rigid containers and placed curbside by 7am of the collection day.

No plastic bags will be accepted.

Containers or paper yard bags should not exceed 40 pounds each.

Christmas trees are also collected curbside. Trees over 5 feet in length must be cut in half for pickup. Please remove all ornaments and tinsel before placing curbside.

Please do not place yard waste in the street or near storm drains.

Oversized yard waste can be collected for a fee.

Note: All yard debris accumulated by a tree service must be hauled off by the company that performed the service within a reasonable amount of time.

Before attempting to burn yard waste, contact the Florida Division of Forestry at (352) 395-4951 or 1-800-HELP-FLA (435-7352).​​​​

​

False

Holiday Schedule

Holiday Schedule

Only six holidays affect collection service:

Thanksgiving

Christmas

New Year's Day

Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.'s Birthday (observed)

Memorial Day

Fourth of July

​

Waste will not be collected on these holidays, and all scheduled pickups will be delayed by one (business) day. Collection will return to the normal the following week.

False

Curbside Service Areas

Curbside Service Areas

Alachua County provides curbside waste collection and recycling to designated residential areas.

Residents of subscription-only areas may subscribe curbside pickup directly with GFL Environmental​, or dispose of household waste at one of the five Rural Collection Centers. Alachua County residents who subscribe to garbage collection service should contact their hauler for recycling information.

For questions regarding your address and service options, please contact the Office of Waste Collection, or call 352-338-3233.

Recycling collection service at apartment complexes is mandatory and is arranged by the owner or manager of the complex. Please speak with your apartment staff for information on recycling in apartment complexes.​​​

False

Collection Days

Collection Days

Curbside waste services in unincorporated Alachua County are currently serviced Monday through Thursday. If you are unsure of your collection day, please contact the Office of Waste Collection at 352-338-3233.

False

Curbside Disabled Pickup

Curbside Disabled Pickup

​Disabled Alachua County residents who live in curbside service areas are eligible to receive backdoor service. The service will be provided at no additional charge.

To obtain this service, a customer must:

Complete a disabled waiver form for backdoor collection service

Furnish a physician's statement verifying that he/she is physically unable to take the receptacles to the curbside/roadside

Attest that no other home residents are physically able to take the receptacles to the curbside/roadside.

Approved waivers are good for one year. Waiver forms can be obtained by contacting the Office of Waste Collection or calling 352-338-3233.

False

Changing Your Cart Size

Changing Your Cart Size

Alachua County curbside customers can change their garbage cart size to fit their needs. Available sizes are mini-can, 35, 64 & 96 gallons. Cart sizes are assessed at different rates on your property tax statement. For more information, please see our Pay-As-You-Throw​ program.

Contact the Alachua County Office of Waste Collection, or the City of Gainesville for more information or to request a different cart. If you are a subscription service customer, please contact WCA Waste Corporation.

If you have excess garbage, place the garbage in an officially marked yellow bag and put it next to your cart. You can purchase these bags at your local Publix Supermarket. Please call the City of Gainesville or Alachua County for the store location nearest you.

​

False

Special Pickups for Large or Bulk Items

Special Pickups for Large or Bulk Items

Alachua County and the City of Gainesville offer free curbside pickup of bulk items to residents with curbside service. Bulk items include furniture such as

Couches

Tables

Chairs

Desks

Mattresses

Limited amounts of interior remodeling debris will also be collected.

For pickup of appliances such as stoves, washers, and dryers, call the County Waste Collection Office (352)338-3233, City of Gainesville (352)334-2330 or the call the City​ in which you live to schedule.

Special collections of exterior materials may be arranged for a fee.

IMPORTANT: On your collection day, the bulk item(s) must be kept separate from any other trash or debris. Items that will fit in a garbage cart or yellow overflow trash bag are not considered “bulk”.

​

​

​

False

Follow Us

​ ​​​​​​​​​ ​​​​​

Alachua County aims to continually improve the accessibility and usability of its website. If you are an individual with a disability and you experience difficulty or require assistance or accommodation in using our website, please contact the Alachua County ADA Coordinator at ADA@alachuacounty.us or call the Alachua County Equal Opportunity Office at 352-374-5275; TDD/TTY Users please call 711 Florida Relay Service.

View Alachua County's Website Accessibility Policy And Procedures

If you have a disability and need an accommodation in order to participate in a County program, service or public meeting, please contact the Equal Opportunity Office at 352-374-5275 at least 2 business days prior to the event. TDD users, please call 711 (Florida Relay Service).

To make a public records request, please contact the Public Records Custodian at (352) 264-6906 or publicrecordsrequest@alachuacounty.us. Please visit the Public Records Request webpage for more information.

This website is a public service. Please read the Legal Disclaimer. Website designed and engineered by Alachua County ITS, Applications Division Version 2014 (v1.0) Under Florida law (Statute 119.011), all information, including e-mail, written letters, documents and phone messages, sent to the Alachua County Board of County Commissioners is subject to Public Records law. This includes the sender's e-mail address, home address or phone number if shown in the message, the content of the message and any associated attachments to the mail. Also please be aware that electronic correspondence (e-mail) is made available on the Commission's public archive site immediately upon being sent. Instead, contact Alachua County Offices by phone or in writing.
